text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take a census of the entire community of the people of Israel, according to their clans and their fathers’ houses. Count the names of every male, one by one,
speaker: Narrator

text: twenty years old and up, all who are of age to serve in Israel’s army. Aaron and you are to register them by their military units.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man from each tribe will be with you. Every one of them will be the head of his fathers’ house.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are the names of the men who will assist you:
from Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Zebulun, Eliab the son of Helon;
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: from Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the men chosen from the community, the chiefs of the tribes of their fathers. They were the heads of Israel’s divisions.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron brought together these men, who had been designated by name.
speaker: Narrator

text: They assembled the entire community on the first day of the second month, and they recorded the people’s ancestry by their clans, by their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those who were twenty years old and up, one by one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses registered them in the Wilderness of Sinai, exactly as the Lord commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing one by one the names of every male twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Reuben totaled 46,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Simeon were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing one by one the names of every male twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Simeon totaled 59,300.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Gad were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Gad totaled 45,650.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Judah were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Judah totaled 74,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Issachar were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Issachar totaled 54,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Zebulun were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Zebulun totaled 57,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Joseph who were the descendants of Ephraim were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Ephraim totaled 40,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were male descendants of Manasseh were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Manasseh totaled 32,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Benjamin were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Benjamin totaled 35,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Dan were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Dan totaled 62,700.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Asher were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Asher totaled 41,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The male descendants of Naphtali were registered from their family records, according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, listing the names of those twenty years old and up, all who were of age to serve in the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered from the tribe of Naphtali totaled 53,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the men who were registered by Moses and Aaron and twelve tribal chiefs of Israel, each representing his fathers’ house.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all of the Israelite men twenty years old and up, who were of age to serve in Israel’s army, were registered according to their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered totaled 603,550.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites were not registered along with the others on the basis of their fathers’ tribe,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Lord had said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You are not to register the tribe of Levi, neither will you take a census of them along with the other Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, appoint the Levites over the Dwelling of the Testimony and over all its furnishings and over everything that belongs to it. They are to carry the Dwelling and all its furnishings. They are to take care of it, and they are to camp around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the Dwelling is to move, the Levites will take it down, and whenever the Dwelling is to stop for a new camp, the Levites will set it up. Any unauthorized person who comes near it must be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites will set up camp, everyone in his own camp and under his own standard, according to their military divisions.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites will camp around the Dwelling of the Testimony so that wrath will not fall on the Israelite community. In this way the Levites will perform the duties for the Dwelling of the Testimony.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites did everything that the Lord commanded Moses, exactly as he commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron as follows:
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of the Israelites will camp under his own standard, with the banners for their fathers’ houses. They will camp around the Tent of Meeting at a distance from it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who camp on the east side toward the sunrise will be organized under the standard of Judah’s camp, according to their military units.
The tribal chief of Judah’s descendants is Nahshon son of Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 74,600.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Issachar will camp next to Judah. The tribal chief of Issachar’s descendants is Nethanel son of Zuar.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 54,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Zebulun will be next. The tribal chief of Zebulun’s descendants is Eliab son of Helon.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 57,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those registered in Judah’s camp are 186,400, according to their military units. They will set out first.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who camp on the south side will be organized under the standard of Reuben’s camp, according to their military units.
The tribal chief of Reuben’s descendants is Elizur son of Shedeur.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 46,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Simeon will camp next to Reuben. The tribal chief of Simeon’s descendants is Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 59,300.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Gad will be next. The tribal chief of Gad’s descendants will be Eliasaph son of Deuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 45,650.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those registered in Reuben’s camp are 151,450, according to their military units. They will set out second.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Tent of Meeting will set out with the Levites’ camp, which is in the middle of the camps. They are to set out in the same order as they camp, each one in his place, following their standards.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who camp on the west side will be organized under the standard of Ephraim’s camp, according to their military units.
The tribal chief of Ephraim’s descendants is Elishama son of Ammihud.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 40,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to Ephraim will be the tribe of Manasseh. The tribal chief of Manasseh’s descendants is Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 32,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Benjamin will be next. The tribal chief of Benjamin’s descendants is Abidan son of Gideoni.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 35,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those registered in Ephraim’s camp are 108,100, according to their military units. They will set out third.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who camp on the north side will be organized under the standard of Dan’s camp, according to their military units.
The tribal chief of Dan’s descendants is Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 62,700.
speaker: Narrator

text: Next to Dan will be the tribe of Asher. The tribal chief of Asher’s descendants will be Pagiel son of Ochran.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 41,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Naphtali will be next. The tribal chief of Naphtali’s descendants is Ahira son of Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: His unit, as registered, totals 53,400.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those registered in Dan’s camp are 157,600. They will set out last, following their standards.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the Israelites who were registered according to their fathers’ houses. All the men in the camps, organized according to their military units, as registered, totaled 603,550.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites were not registered among the Israelites, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites did everything that the Lord commanded Moses. They camped around their standards, and they set out, every one of them by their clans, according to their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the family history of Aaron and Moses at the time when the Lord spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of Aaron’s sons: Nadab the firstborn, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the names of Aaron’s sons, the anointed priests, whom he ordained to serve as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nadab and Abihu died in the presence of the Lord when they offered unauthorized fire before the Lord in the Wilderness of Sinai, and they had no sons. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests in the presence of Aaron their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Bring the tribe of Levi near and have them stand before Aaron the priest so that they may assist him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will perform the duties for him and for the entire congregation in front of the Tent of Meeting by doing the work for the Dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will take care of all the furnishings for the Tent of Meeting and perform the duties of the Israelites by doing the work for the Dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will give the Levites to Aaron and to his sons. They are completely given to him from among the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you will appoint Aaron and his sons, and they will serve in the priesthood. Any unauthorized person who goes near must be put to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, I have taken the Levites from among the Israelites instead of every firstborn that opens the womb among the Israelites. The Levites are mine,
speaker: Narrator

text: for all the firstborn are mine. On the day that I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I set apart for myself every firstborn in Israel, both human and animal. They are mine. I am the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Register the Levites according to their fathers’ houses, by their clans. You are to register every male a month old and up.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses registered them as he was commanded by the word of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the names of the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the names of the sons of Gershon according to their clans: Libni and Shimei.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Kohath according to their clans were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The sons of Merari according to their clans were Mahli and Mushi.
The following were the clans of the Levites according to their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Gershon came the Libnite clan and the Shimeite clan. These were the Gershonite clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered, counting all the males who were a month old and up, were 7,500.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Gershonite clans camped behind the Dwelling on the west side.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribal chief of the father’s house for the Gershonites was Eliasaph son of Lael.
speaker: Narrator

text: The duties of the descendants of Gershon in the Tent of Meeting involved the dwelling and the tent, its coverings, and the screen for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: also the hangings of the courtyard, and the screen for the entrance to the courtyard which surrounds the Dwelling and the altar, and its ropes—everything related to this work.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Kohath came the Amramite clan, the Izharite clan, the Hebronite clan, and the Uzzielite clan. These were the Kohathite clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Counting all the males who were a month old and up, there were 8,600 to perform the duties of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clans of the descendants of Kohath camped on the south side of the Dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribal chief of the father’s house for the Kohathite clans was Elizaphan son of Uzziel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their duties involved the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the sanctuary utensils with which they serve, and the screen—everything related to this work.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribal chief over the Levite tribal chiefs was Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest. He was in charge of those performing the duties of the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Merari came the Mahlite clan and the Mushite clan. These were the Merarite clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were registered, counting all the males who were a month old and up, were 6,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribal chief of the father’s house for the Merarite clans was Zuriel son of Abihail. They camped on the north side of the Dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: The appointed duties for the sons of Merari involved the Dwelling’s boards, its crossbars, its posts, its bases, all its equipment—everything related to this work,
speaker: Narrator

text: also the posts for the surrounding courtyard, their bases, their tent pegs, and their ropes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who camped in front of the Dwelling on the east side, in front of the Tent of Meeting, toward the sunrise, were Moses and Aaron and Aaron’s sons, who were performing the duties of the sanctuary on behalf of the Israelites. Any unauthorized person who goes near shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of the Levities who were registered when the Lord commanded Moses and Aaron to register them according to their clans, every male a month old and up, were 22,000.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Register all the firstborn males of the Israelites one month old and up, and make a list of their names.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to take the Levites for me—I am the Lord—instead of every firstborn among the Israelites, and take the livestock of the Levites instead of every firstborn among the livestock of the Israelites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses registered all the firstborn among the Israelites as the Lord commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the firstborn males listed by name, one month old and up, when registered, totaled 22,273.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the Levites instead of every firstborn among the Israelites, and the livestock of the Levites instead of their livestock. The Levites will be mine. I am the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the redemption of the 273 firstborn Israelites who outnumber the Levites,
speaker: Narrator

text: you are to collect five shekels apiece for each one, according to the sanctuary shekel (this shekel is twenty gerahs).
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to give the money, the redemption price for the additional Israelites, to Aaron and his sons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses collected the redemption money from those who outnumbered the ones redeemed by the Levites who took their place.
speaker: Narrator

text: He collected the money from the firstborn of the Israelites, 1,365 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and to his sons, in obedience to the word of the Lord, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses and Aaron
speaker: Narrator

text: to take a census of the descendants of Kohath among the Levites, by their clans, by their fathers’ houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old to fifty years old, everyone eligible for the service of performing the tasks at the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the work for the descendants of Kohath at the Tent of Meeting: to take care of the most holy things.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the camp sets out, Aaron and his sons are to go into the Dwelling. They are to take down the veil that screens the ark, cover the Ark of the Testimony with it,
speaker: Narrator

text: put a covering made from the hides of sea cows over it, spread a solid blue cloth over that, and insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the table for the Bread of the Presence they are to spread a blue cloth and put the dishes, the small bowls, the larger bowls, and the pitchers for the drink offering on it. The bread that is continually there is to remain on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they are to spread a scarlet cloth over these things, cover them with a covering made from the hides of sea cows, and insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand used for light, its lamps, its snuffers, its fire pans, and all the jars of oil used to supply it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to put the lampstand and all its accessories under a cover made from the hides of sea cows and put it on a carrying frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Over the golden altar they are to spread a blue cloth, cover it with a covering made from the hides of sea cows, and insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to take all the utensils which they use in the sanctuary and put them in a blue cloth, cover them with a covering made from the hides of sea cows, and put them on a carrying frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to remove the fat-soaked ashes from the altar and spread a purple cloth over it.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to put on it all the utensils which they use around the altar: the fire pans, the meat hooks, the shovels, and the basins—the utensils of the altar. They will spread a covering made of the hides of sea cows over the altar and insert its poles.
speaker: Narrator

text: After Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sanctuary and all the items of the sanctuary, when the camp sets out, the descendants of Kohath will come to carry them. But they are not to touch the sanctuary or they will die. The descendants of Kohath are to carry these things associated with the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, shall be in charge of the lamp oil, the fragrant incense, the daily grain offering, and the anointing oil. He shall be in charge of the entire Dwelling, everything in it, the holy objects, and its furnishings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do not allow the tribe of the Kohathite clans to be cut off from among the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do this for them so that they may live and not die when they come near the most holy things: Aaron and his sons are to go in and assign to each one of them what he is to do and what he is to carry.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Kohathites must not go in to see the sanctuary even for a moment or they will die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also told Moses
speaker: Narrator

text: to take a census of the descendants of Gershon, according to their fathers’ houses, by their clans,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to register those from thirty years old to fifty years old, everyone eligible for the service of doing the work at the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the work for the Gershonite clans: the work of moving the Dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to carry the curtains of the Dwelling, the Tent of Meeting, its covering, and the covering made of sea cow hides that is on top of that, the screen for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings for the courtyard, the screen for the entrance through the gate into the courtyard which surrounds the Dwelling and the altar, the ropes, and all the items related to this work. They are responsible for everything that is to be done with these things.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the work of the descendants of the Gershonites, everything they are to carry and all the work they are to do, is to be done at the command of Aaron and his sons. You are to assign to each of them everything they are to carry.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the work for the clans of the descendants of the Gershonites in regard to the Tent of Meeting. They are to serve under the direction of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for the descendants of Merari, register them according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Register all of them who are between thirty years old and fifty years old, everyone eligible for service, to do the work for the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what they are responsible for as their entire work at the Tent of Meeting: to carry the Dwelling’s boards, its crossbars, its posts, its bases,
speaker: Narrator

text: the posts of the surrounding courtyard and their bases, their tent pegs, their ropes with all their equipment, and everything related to this work. You are to specify by name the items that they are responsible to carry.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the work for the clans of the descendants of Merari, regarding all their work in regard to the Tent of Meeting, under the direction of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses, Aaron, and the tribal chiefs of the community registered the descendants of the Kohathites according to their clans and their fathers’ houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old to fifty years old, everyone eligible for service, for work at the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ones registered according to their clans were 2,750.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the ones registered from the clans of the Kohathites, all those who worked at the Tent of Meeting. Moses and Aaron registered them according to the Lord’s command through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gershon were registered according to their clans and according to their fathers’ houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old to fifty years old, everyone eligible for service, for work at the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ones registered according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses, were 2,630.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the ones registered from the clans of the descendants of Gershon, all those who worked at the Tent of Meeting. Moses and Aaron registered them according to the Lord’s command.
speaker: Narrator

text: The clans of the descendants of Merari were registered according to their clans, according to their fathers’ houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old to fifty years old, everyone eligible for service, for work at the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those registered by their clans were 3,200.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the ones registered from the clans of the descendants of Merari. Moses and Aaron registered them according to the Lord’s command through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every one of the Levites was registered. Moses and Aaron and the tribal chiefs of Israel registered them according to their clans and their fathers’ houses,
speaker: Narrator

text: from thirty years old to fifty years old, everyone who was eligible to perform the work of serving at or carrying the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those registered totaled 8,580.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the Lord’s command, they were registered by Moses, along with what each man was assigned to do and to carry. They were registered just as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the Israelites to send outside of the camp everyone who has an impure skin disease, everyone who has a bodily discharge, and everyone who is unclean because of contact with a dead body.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must send them away, male or female. You must send them outside of the camp so that they will not defile their camps, where I dwell in their midst.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites did exactly that and sent them outside of the camp. The Israelites did just as the Lord said to Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and told him
speaker: Narrator

text:
to tell the Israelites this:
Whenever a man or a woman commits any wrong against another person and so in this way is unfaithful to the Lord, that person must be held responsible.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such people are to confess the wrong which they have done. They are to make full restitution for their guilt, then add one fifth of its value on top of that and give it to the person they have wronged.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the wronged person has no next-of-kin to receive the restitution, the restitution goes to the Lord for the priest, in addition to the atonement ram, with which the priest will make atonement for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every elevated offering that the Israelites present to the priest will belong to the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone’s holy things are his own, but whatever anyone gives to the priest is the priest’s.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses to speak to the Israelites and tell them this:
speaker: Narrator

text: If any man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and another man lies down with her, but this remains hidden from her husband and she is not found out, she has defiled herself even though there is no witness against her and she was not caught in the act.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a feeling of jealousy comes over her husband and he becomes jealous of his wife who has defiled herself, or if a feeling of jealousy comes over him and he is jealous of his wife, even though she has not defiled herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: then the man is to bring his wife to the priest. He is also to bring an offering on her behalf: two quarts of barley flour. He is not to pour oil on it or put frankincense on it, because it is a grain offering for jealousy, a grain offering for remembrance, to reveal guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest is to bring her near and present her before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest is to take holy water in a clay vessel, take some of the dust that is on the floor of the Dwelling, and put it into the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest is to present the woman before the Lord, let down the woman’s hair, and put into her hands the grain offering for remembrance, which is the grain offering for jealousy. The priest is to have in his hands the bitter water that brings a curse.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will make her take an oath, and he will tell the woman, “If no man has slept with you, and if you have not gone astray by becoming defiled while married to your husband, may this bitter water that brings a curse not affect you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you have gone astray while married to your husband, and if you are defiled and another man besides your husband has had sex with you—”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the priest will make the woman take an oath with a curse, and the priest will tell the woman, “May the Lord make you an object of cursing and swearing among your people when the Lord allows your thigh to shrivel and your belly to swell.
speaker: Narrator

text: May this water that brings a curse go inside you and make your belly swell and your thigh shrivel.” The woman will say, “Amen, Amen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest is to write these curses on a scroll and wipe them off into the bitter water.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will make the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse. The water that brings a curse will enter into her and become bitter.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will take the grain offering for jealousy out of the woman’s hand, wave the grain offering before the Lord, and bring it to the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will take a handful of the grain offering as its memorial portion and burn it on the altar. Afterward he will make the woman drink the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he has made her drink the water, if she has defiled herself and has been unfaithful to her husband, the water that brings a curse will enter into her and become bitter. Her belly will swell, and her thigh will shrivel. The woman will be an object of cursing among her people.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the woman has not defiled herself but is clean, then she will be unaffected and will be able to conceive children.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the law regarding jealousy when a wife, while married to her husband, goes astray and defiles herself,
speaker: Narrator

text: or when a feeling of jealousy comes over a husband and he is jealous of his wife. Then the man will present the woman before the Lord, and the priest will apply this entire procedure to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man will be free from guilt, but that woman will bear her guilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses to speak to the Israelites and tell them these things:
speaker: Narrator

text: When a man or woman makes a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate oneself to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: he is to abstain from wine and beer. He may not drink vinegar made from wine or beer. He may not drink any grape juice. He may not eat fresh grapes or raisins.
speaker: Narrator

text: During his entire separation, he is not to eat anything at all that comes from the grapevine, from the seeds to the skins.
speaker: Narrator

text: During his entire vow of separation no razor is to pass over his head, until the time that he has separated himself to the Lord has been completed. He will be set apart as holy. He is to let the hair of his head grow long.
speaker: Narrator

text: During the entire time that he separates himself to the Lord he may not go near a dead body.
speaker: Narrator

text: He may not defile himself even for his father or his mother or for his brother or his sister when they die, because his sign of separation for God is on his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: During the entire time of his separation he is set apart as holy to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: If someone near him dies suddenly, thereby defiling the head of hair that marks his separation, he is to shave his head on the day when he is purified. On the seventh day he is to shave it.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the eighth day he will bring two turtledoves or two pigeons to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. He will make atonement for him, because he sinned on account of the dead body. On that same day, he is to consecrate his head.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will establish a new time of separation to the Lord. He will bring a year-old male lamb as a restitution offering. His previous time of separation will not count, because his separation was defiled.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the law for the Nazirite when the time of his separation is over: He is to be brought to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will bring this as his offering to the Lord: a year-old male lamb without defect as a whole burnt offering, a year-old female lamb without defect as a sin offering, one ram without defect as a fellowship offering,
speaker: Narrator

text: a basket of unleavened round loaves made with fine flour mixed with oil, unleavened wafers coated with oil, along with the specified grain offerings and drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will bring them before the Lord and will offer the Nazirite’s sin offering and burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will offer the ram as the sacrifice for the fellowship offering to the Lord, along with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest will also offer the specified grain offering and drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Nazirite is to shave the hair on his head, that marks his separation at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. He is to take the hair from his head, that marks his separation, and put it on the fire which is under the sacrifice for the fellowship offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will take the boiled shoulder from the ram and one unleavened round loaf out of the basket and one unleavened wafer, and put them into the palms of the Nazirite after he has shaved the head that marks his separation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will wave them as a wave offering before the Lord. This is the holy portion for the priest, together with the breast that is waved and the thigh that is elevated. After that, the Nazirite may drink wine.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the law for the Nazirite who vows his offering to the Lord according to his separation, in addition to whatever else he can afford. Just as he has made this vow, so he must carry it out according to the law governing his separation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses
speaker: Narrator

text: to speak to Aaron and to his sons and to tell them to bless the Israelites with these words:
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord bless you and keep you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord make his face shine on you
and be gracious to you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord look on you with favor
and give you peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this way they will put my name on the Israelites, and I will bless them.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the day that Moses finished setting up the Dwelling, he anointed and consecrated it with all of its furnishings and the altar with all of its utensils. He anointed and consecrated them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribal chiefs of Israel, the heads of their fathers’ houses, brought offerings. These were the chiefs of the tribes, who were in charge of the registration.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought as their offering before the Lord six covered carts and twelve oxen—a cart for every two tribal chiefs and an ox for every tribal chief. They presented them in front of the Dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Accept these gifts from them so that they may be used for doing the work at the Tent of Meeting. You are to give them to the Levites as each one’s work requires.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses took the carts and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave two carts and four oxen to the descendants of Gershon as their work required.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave four carts and eight oxen to the descendants of Merari, as required for their work under the direction of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the descendants of Kohath he did not give any, because their work was to carry the holy things on their own shoulders.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribal chiefs also brought offerings for the dedication of the altar on the day that it was anointed. The tribal chiefs brought their offerings before the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Each day one tribal chief will bring his offering for the dedication of the altar.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day, the one who brought his offering was Nahshon son of Amminadab from the tribe of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: His offering was one silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, one silver sprinkling basin weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one small gold bowl weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
speaker: Narrator

text: one young bull, one ram, one year-old male lamb for a whole burnt offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: one male goat for a sin offering;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering: two head of cattle, five rams, five male breeding goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering of Nahshon son of Amminadab.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the second day Nethanel son of Zuar, the tribal chief of Issachar, brought his offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought for his offering: one silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, one silver sprinkling basin weighing seventy shekels according to the sanctuary shekel, both full of fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;

speaker: Narrator

text: one small gold bowl weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

text: and for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering: two head of cattle, five rams, five male breeding goats, and five one-year-old male lambs. This was the offering of Ahira son of Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the offerings from the tribal chiefs of Israel for the dedication of the altar on the day that it was anointed: twelve silver dishes, twelve silver sprinkling basins, twelve small gold bowls.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each silver dish weighed one hundred thirty shekels, and each sprinkling basin weighed seventy shekels. All the silver vessels weighed two thousand four hundred shekels according to the sanctuary shekel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The twelve gold bowls, filled with incense, weighed ten shekels each, according to the sanctuary shekel. All the gold bowls weighed one hundred twenty shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the cattle for the whole burnt offering were twelve young bulls, twelve rams, twelve one-year-old male lambs, along with their grain offerings. Also there were twelve male breeding goats for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the cattle for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering were twenty-four young bulls, sixty rams, sixty male breeding goats, and sixty one-year-old male lambs. These were the offerings for the dedication of the altar after it was anointed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses went into the Tent of Meeting to speak with the Lord, he heard the Lord’s voice speaking to him from between the two cherubim above the atonement seat that was on the Ark of the Covenant. In this way the Lord spoke to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to Aaron and tell him, ‘When you set up the lamps, the seven lamps are to give light in front of the lampstand.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So that is what Aaron did. He set up the lamps to light the area in front of the lampstand, just as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was how the lampstand was made: It was a work of hammered gold. From its base to its blossoms, it was one hammered piece. So the lampstand was made according to the pattern that the Lord had shown Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses
speaker: Narrator

text: to take the Levites from among the Israelites and to do the following to make them ceremonially clean:
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what you are to do to them to make them ceremonially clean: Sprinkle the water of purification on them. Have them shave their entire body with a razor, wash their clothes, and purify themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they are to take a young bull from the herd with its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil. You are to take another young bull from the herd for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to present the Levites in front of the Tent of Meeting. You are to assemble the entire Israelite community.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to present the Levites before the Lord. The Israelites will place their hands on the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Aaron will offer the Levites before the Lord as a wave offering on behalf of the Israelites. They are to do the work of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites are to place their hands on the heads of the young bulls. You then will offer the one young bull as a sin offering and the other young bull as a whole burnt offering to the Lord to make atonement for the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will have the Levites stand in front of Aaron and his sons, and you will offer them as a wave offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this way you are to set apart the Levites from the other Israelites, and the Levites will be mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: After you have purified them and offered them as a wave offering, the Levites will go to work at the Tent of Meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: because only they are given to me as servants from among the Israelites. In place of every firstborn from the womb, the firstborn of every Israelite, I have taken the Levites for myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the firstborn among the Israelites are mine, both human and animal. On the day that I struck all the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I set the firstborn of the Israelites apart for myself.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have taken the Levites in place of every firstborn among the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: From among the Israelites I have given only the Levites to Aaron and his sons to do the work of the people of Israel at the Tent of Meeting and to make atonement for the people of Israel so that there will not be any plague among the Israelites when the Israelites approach the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses, Aaron, and the entire community of the people of Israel did for the Levites just as they had been told. The Israelites did for them everything that the Lord commanded Moses in regard to the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothing. Aaron offered them as a wave offering before the Lord and made atonement for them to purify them.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that, the Levites went to do their work at the Tent of Meeting in the presence of Aaron and his sons. Just as the Lord had commanded Moses about the Levites, that is exactly what they did for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “This applies to the Levites: From twenty-five years of age and up, they are to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they are fifty years old, they are to retire from the service and no longer work.
speaker: Narrator

text: They may assist their brothers at the Tent of Meeting in performing their duties, but they are not to do the work. This is exactly what you are to do in regard to the Levites and their duties.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai, during the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “The people of Israel are to observe the Passover at its appointed time.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, you will observe it at its appointed time. You will observe it according to all its regulations and all its ordinances.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses told the Israelites to observe the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: They observed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month, at twilight, in the Wilderness of Sinai. The Israelites did everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were some men, however, who were unclean because of contact with a dead body. So they were not able to observe the Passover on that day. They went before Moses and Aaron on that same day.
speaker: Narrator

text: These men said to him, “We are unclean because of a dead body. Why should we be kept from presenting the offering of the Lord at its appointed time among the people of Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses said to them, “Wait and let me hear what the Lord commands concerning you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses
speaker: Narrator

text:
and told him to tell the Israelites this:
If any one of you or your descendants is unclean because of contact with a dead body or is on a distant journey, he may still observe the Passover to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Such people are to observe it during the second month, on the fourteenth day, at twilight. They are to eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must not leave any of it until morning. They are not to break a single one of its bones. They are to observe the Passover according to every regulation for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But anyone who is clean and is not on a journey yet fails to observe the Passover will be cut off from his people. He will bear his sin because he did not present the offering of the Lord at its appointed time.
speaker: Narrator

text: If an alien dwells among you and desires to observe the Passover to the Lord, he is to do so according to the regulation for the Passover and its ordinance. You are to have one regulation, the same for the alien and for the native of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the day that the Dwelling was set up, the cloud covered the Dwelling, that is, the Tent of the Testimony. The cloud over the Dwelling looked like fire from evening until morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was always like this: The cloud would cover the Dwelling, and at night it looked like fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the cloud above the tent lifted up, the Israelites would set out. Wherever the cloud settled down, the Israelites would camp at that spot.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the command of the Lord, the Israelites set out, and at the command of the Lord they set up camp. For the entire time that the cloud settled over the Dwelling, they would keep their camp at that place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cloud stayed over the Dwelling for many days, the Israelites would keep the Lord’s order and would not set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sometimes the cloud would be over the Dwelling for only a few days. Then according to the command of the Lord the Israelites would remain camped at that place. Then at the command of the Lord they would set out again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sometimes the cloud was over the Dwelling only from evening until morning. So when the cloud lifted up in the morning, they set out. Whether by day or by night, when the cloud lifted up, they set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whether it was two days, a month, or a year that the cloud stayed settled over the Dwelling, the Israelites remained camped at that place and did not set out. But when it lifted up, they set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the command of the Lord they camped, and at the command of the Lord they set out. They kept the Lord’s order, following the command of the Lord given through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses
speaker: Narrator

text:
to make two trumpets of hammered silver and to use them in this way:
You will use them to summon the community and to have the camp set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they blow both trumpets, the entire community will gather to you at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: If they blow just one trumpet, then the tribal chiefs, the heads of the Israelite clans, will gather to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you blow the signal on the trumpets, the camps that are on the east side will set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you blow the signal a second time, the camps that are on the south side will set out. This will be the signal to set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the community is to gather, you will blow the trumpets, but you will not sound the signal for setting out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron’s sons, the priests, will blow the trumpets. This will be a permanent regulation for you and for your descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you go out into battle in your own land against an adversary who attacks you, you will sound the signal with the trumpets. Then you will be remembered before the Lord your God, and you will be saved from your enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also at the times when you rejoice, at your appointed festivals and at the New Moon, you will blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings and over the sacrifices of your fellowship offerings. They will serve as a memorial for you before your God. I am the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the twentieth day of the second month, in the second year, the cloud lifted up above the Dwelling of the Testimony.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites set out on their journey from the Wilderness of Sinai. The cloud settled in the Wilderness of Paran.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the first time, they set out according to the command of the Lord through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: First, the standard for the camp of Judah’s descendants set out according to their military units. Nahshon son of Amminadab was over Judah’s unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nethanel son of Zuar was over the unit for the tribe of Issachar’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliab son of Helon was over the unit for the tribe of Zebulun’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Dwelling was then taken down. The sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari set out, carrying the Dwelling.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard for the camp of Reuben set out according to their military units. Elizur son of Shedeur was over Reuben’s unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai was over the unit for the tribe of Simeon’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Eliasaph son of Deuel was over the unit for the tribe of Gad’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Kohathites then set out, carrying the holy things. The others would set up the Dwelling before they arrived.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard for the camp of Ephraim’s descendants set out according to their military units. Elishama son of Ammihud was over Ephraim’s unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gamaliel son of Pedahzur was over the unit for the tribe of Manasseh’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abidan son of Gideoni was over the unit for the tribe of Benjamin’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: The standard for the camp of Dan’s descendants, serving as the rear guard for the entire camp, set out according to their military units. Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai was over Dan’s unit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pagiel son of Ochran was over the unit for the tribe of Asher’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahira son of Enan was over the unit for the tribe of Naphtali’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the marching order for the Israelites, according to their military units. This is how they set out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to Hobab, the son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out to the place about which the Lord promised, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us, and we will treat you well, for the Lord has promised good concerning Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Hobab said to him, “I will not go, but I will go to my own land and to my own relatives.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “Please do not leave us, because you know where we should camp in the wilderness. You can be our eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you will go with us, whatever good the Lord does for us, we will do for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the mountain of the Lord on a three-day journey. The Ark of the Lord’s Covenant set out before them for that three-day journey to find a resting place for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cloud of the Lord was over them by day, when they set out from the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the ark set out, Moses would say, “Rise up, O Lord, and may your enemies be scattered! May those who hate you flee before you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When it came to rest, he would say, “Return, O Lord, to the countless thousands of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people were complaining about their hardships so that the Lord heard it. When the Lord heard it, his anger burned. So the Lord’s fire burned among them and consumed some of the outskirts of the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people cried out to Moses, and Moses prayed to the Lord. So the fire died down.
speaker: Narrator

text: They named that place Taberah, because the Lord’s fire burned among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The foreign rabble who were among the Israelites were overcome by their craving. The Israelites also wept once again and said, “Who is going to give us meat to eat?
speaker: Narrator

text: We remember the fish we ate in Egypt free of charge, the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now our lives are wasting away. We have nothing at all to look at except this manna.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The manna was like coriander seed, and it looked like resin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people went around and gathered it up. They would grind it in hand mills or crush it in a mortar. They would boil it in pots or make it into loaves. It tasted like a cake made with oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: When dew fell on the camp during the night, the manna fell along with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses heard people from all the clans weeping, each one at the entrance to his own tent. At the same time, the Lord’s anger burned fiercely, and Moses was displeased.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the Lord, “Why have you treated your servant so badly? Why have I not found favor in your eyes? Why do you put the burden of all these people on me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did I conceive all these people by myself? Am I the one who gave birth to them so that you tell me to carry them in my arms to the land which you swore to their fathers, just as a woman who is nursing carries a baby?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is there meat for me to give to all these people? Listen, they are weeping to me and saying, ‘Give us meat so that we can eat.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not able to carry all these people by myself, because that is too much for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are going to treat me this way, please kill me right now. If I have found favor in your eyes, do not let me see my own ruin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord said to Moses, “Gather seventy men from the elders of Israel for me, men whom you know to be elders and officers for the people. Take them to the Tent of Meeting and make them stand there with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will come down and talk with you there. I will take from the Spirit that is on you and will put it on them. They will share the burden of the people with you so that you will not have to carry it by yourself.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Say to the people, ‘Consecrate yourselves to be ready for tomorrow. You will eat meat because you have wept and the Lord has heard you say, “Who will give us meat to eat? Yes, things were good for us in Egypt.” Therefore the Lord will give you meat, and you will eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will eat not just for one day, for two days, for five days, for ten days, not even just for twenty days,
speaker: Narrator

text: but for a whole month, until meat comes out of your nostrils, and you begin to loathe it. This will happen because you have rejected the Lord, who is among you, and you have wept in his presence, saying, “Why did we come out of Egypt?”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “I am in the middle of a people with six hundred thousand foot soldiers, and now you say, ‘I will give them meat, and they will eat for a whole month.’
speaker: Narrator

text: If flocks and herds were slaughtered for them, would that be enough for them? If all the fish of the sea were caught for them, would that be enough for them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Is the arm of the Lord too short? Now you will see whether what I have said to you will happen or not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses went out and told the people the Lord’s words. He gathered seventy men from the elders of the people and had them stand all around the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord came down in the cloud and spoke to him. He took from the Spirit that was on Moses and put it on the seventy elders. When the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but they did not do it again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two men, however, remained in the camp. The name of one was Eldad, and the name of the other was Medad. They were listed among the elders, but they had not gone out to the tent. The Spirit rested on them, and they prophesied back in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: A young man ran and reported this to Moses. He said, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ aide from his youth, answered, “My lord Moses, stop them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to him, “Are you jealous for my sake? If only all of the Lord’s people were prophets so that the Lord would put his Spirit on them!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses returned to the camp along with the elders of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: A wind sent out from the Lord brought quail in from the sea. The wind scattered them throughout the camp (and about a day’s journey in any direction around the camp) about three feet deep on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that day, all that night, and all the next day, the people got up and gathered the quail. No one gathered fewer than sixty bushels. They spread them out around the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: But while the meat was still between their teeth, before it was chewed, the Lord’s anger burned against the people, and the Lord struck the people with a very severe plague.
speaker: Narrator

text: They named that place Kibroth Hatta’avah, because there they buried the people who were overcome by their craving.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Kibroth Hatta’avah the people traveled to Hazeroth, and they stayed at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman he had married (for he had married a Cushite woman).
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Has the Lord really spoken only through Moses? Hasn’t he also spoken through us?” The Lord heard this.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now the man Moses was very humble, more humble than anyone else on the face of the earth.)
speaker: Narrator

text:
Right then the Lord spoke suddenly to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “You three come out to the Tent of Meeting!”
The three of them came out.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord came down in a pillar of cloud and stood at the entrance to the tent. He called Aaron and Miriam, and they both came forward.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Now listen to my words: If there is a prophet among you, I, the Lord, will make myself known to him in a vision. In a dream I will speak with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not so, however, with my servant Moses. He is faithful in my whole household.
speaker: Narrator

text: With him I speak face-to-face, clearly, and not in riddles. He sees the form of the Lord. Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant, against Moses?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord’s anger burned against them, and he left.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cloud went up from above the tent, and immediately Miriam was leprous, as white as snow. Aaron turned to Miriam and saw that she was leprous.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron said to Moses, “My lord, please do not hold this sin against us. We have acted foolishly. We have sinned.
speaker: Narrator

text: Please do not let her be like a stillborn infant that comes out of its mother’s womb with its flesh half-eaten away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses cried out to the Lord, “God, please heal her, please!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “If her father had merely spit in her face, would she not be disgraced for seven days? Have her confined outside of the camp for seven days, and after that she can be brought back in.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Miriam was confined outside of the camp for seven days, and the people did not set out until Miriam was brought back in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward the people set out from Hazeroth and camped in the Wilderness of Paran.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Send men to scout the land of Canaan, which I myself am giving to the Israelites. You are to send one man from each ancestral tribe, each one a tribal chief among the people of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses sent them from the Wilderness of Paran according to the Lord’s command. All of these men were heads of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These were their names:
From the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Joseph, that is, from the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi son of Susi.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the names of the men whom Moses sent to scout the land. Moses renamed Hoshea son of Nun “Joshua.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses sent them to scout the land of Canaan and said to them, “Go up this way through the Negev and go up into the hill country.
speaker: Narrator

text: See what the land is like. See if the people who live in the land are strong or weak. See if they are few or many.
speaker: Narrator

text: See if the land that they live in is good or bad. See what kind of cities they live in. See if the cities are camps or fortified places.
speaker: Narrator

text: See what the land is like. See if the land is fertile or poor. See if there are trees in the land or not. Be courageous and bring back some of the fruit of the land.” This happened at the season of the first ripe grapes.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went up and scouted the land from the Wilderness of Zin to Rehob, toward Lebo Hamath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went up through the Negev and came to Hebron. Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak, were there. (Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The scouts came to the Valley of Eshcol, and there they cut down a branch with one cluster of grapes. They carried it on a pole between two men, along with some pomegranates and figs.
speaker: Narrator

text: They named that place the Valley of Eshcol, because of the cluster which the Israelites had cut down from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the end of forty days, they returned from scouting the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came back to Moses, Aaron, and the entire community of the Israelites at Kadesh in the Wilderness of Paran. They brought back a report to them and to the entire community. They showed them some of the fruit of the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: They reported to him and said, “We went to the land where you sent us. It really does flow with milk and honey, and here is its fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, the people who live in the land are strong, and the cities are fortified and very large. We also saw the descendants of Anak there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Amalekites are living in the land of the Negev. The Hittites, the Jebusites, and the Amorites are living in the hill country. The Canaanites are living by the sea and along the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Caleb quieted the people before Moses and said, “We should go up now and take possession of it, because we can certainly conquer it!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the men who had gone up with Caleb said, “We are not able to go up against the people, because they are stronger than we are.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they spread a negative report to the Israelites about the land that they had scouted. They said, “The land that we explored and scouted is a land that eats up its inhabitants. All the people we saw in the land were huge.
speaker: Narrator

text: We saw there the Nephilim (the descendants of Anak come from the Nephilim). In our own eyes we seemed like grasshoppers. We seemed like grasshoppers in their eyes too.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The entire community raised a loud cry. The people wept that night.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of the Israelites grumbled against Moses and Aaron. The entire community said to them, “If only we had died in the land of Egypt! If only we had died in this wilderness!
speaker: Narrator

text: Why is the Lord bringing us to this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and our children will be taken as captives! Wouldn’t it be better for us to return to Egypt?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to one another, “Let’s put someone in charge and return to Egypt.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses and Aaron fell facedown before the entire assembly of the Israelite community.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, two of those who had scouted the land, tore their clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: They spoke to the entire Israelite community, “The land that we explored and scouted is a very good land.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Lord is pleased with us, he will bring us into this land and give it to us, a land that is flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only do not revolt against the Lord. Do not fear the people of the land, for we will eat them up. Their protection is taken away from them, and the Lord is with us. Do not fear them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Still the entire community threatened to stone them to death. The Glory of the Lord appeared to all the Israelites over the Tent of Meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “How long will these people treat me with contempt? How long will they not believe in me, in spite of all the signs that I have done among them?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will strike them with a plague and disown them. Then I will make you into a nation greater and mightier than they are.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the Lord, “The Egyptians will hear it, since by your own power you brought these people up from the midst of the Egyptians.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will tell the inhabitants of this land about it. They have heard that you, the Lord, are in the midst of this people. You, the Lord, are seen face-to-face. Your cloud stands over them. You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you killed these people, leaving no one, then the nations which have heard about your fame will say,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Because the Lord was not able to bring these people into the land which he swore to them, he has slaughtered them in the wilderness.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now please let the power of the Lord be great, just as you have said,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The Lord is slow to anger and abounding in mercy, forgiving guilt and rebellion. He certainly does not leave the guilty unpunished, following up on the guilt of the fathers with the children unto the third and the fourth generation.’
speaker: Narrator

text: According to your great mercy, please pardon the guilt of these people, just as you have forgiven these people from Egypt until now.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said, “I have pardoned them just as you have said.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as surely as I live, and as surely as the entire earth is filled with the glory of the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: not one of the men who has seen my glory and my signs, which I did in Egypt and in the wilderness, and who has tested me these ten times and has not listened to my voice—
speaker: Narrator

text: I promise that none of them will see the land which I swore to their fathers. None of those who treated me with contempt will see it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But because my servant Caleb had a different spirit and has followed me completely, I will bring him into the land to which he traveled. His descendants will possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since the Amalekites and the Canaanites are living in the valleys and lowlands, tomorrow you are to turn back and set out into the wilderness along the route to the Red Sea.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron,
speaker: Narrator

text: “How long will this wicked community grumble against me? I have heard the Israelites’ constant grumblings against me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell them, ‘As surely as I live, declares the Lord, I will do to you just as I have heard you say.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this wilderness your corpses will fall. All of you who were registered in the census, every one of you twenty years old and up who have grumbled against me,
speaker: Narrator

text: I swear that none of you will go into the land where I promised to settle you, except for Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: But your children, whom you said would become plunder, I will bring in, and they will experience the land which you have rejected.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, your corpses will fall in this wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your children will be shepherds in the wilderness for forty years. They will have to endure your prostitution until your corpses perish in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will bear the consequences of your guilt for forty years, based on the number of days that you scouted the land, forty days, one year for every day. You will experience my opposition.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I, the Lord, have spoken. I swear that I will do this to this entire wicked community, who are gathered together against me. In this wilderness they will perish. There they will die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The men whom Moses had sent to scout the land, who returned and made the entire community grumble against him by giving a negative report about the land—
speaker: Narrator

text: those men who brought the wicked, negative report about the land—died by the plague before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of those men who had gone to scout the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh remained alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses told these things to all the Israelites, and the people mourned bitterly.
speaker: Narrator

text: They got up early in the morning and went up to the heights of the hill country. They said, “We are ready. We will go up to the place which the Lord spoke about. We admit we have sinned.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “What is this? Why are you going against the Lord’s command? This will not succeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not go up, because the Lord is not among you. You will be struck down before your enemies,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the Amalekites and the Canaanites are there to oppose you. You will fall by the sword because you turned away from following the Lord. Therefore the Lord will not be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they dared to go up to the heights of the hill country. Nevertheless, the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord and Moses did not leave the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Amalekites and the Canaanites, who lived in that hill country, came down, attacked them, and beat them down all the way to Hormah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses
speaker: Narrator

text:
to speak to the Israelites and tell them this:
When you come into the land where you will live, the land which I am giving to you,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you make an offering by fire to the Lord from the herd or the flock, to make a pleasing aroma to the Lord (whether it is a burnt offering or a sacrifice, whether it is to fulfill a vow or as a voluntary offering or at your appointed festivals),
speaker: Narrator

text: the person who presents his offering is to present to the Lord two quarts of fine flour mixed with a quart of oil as a grain offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: For each lamb, for the burnt offering or the sacrifice, you are to supply a quart of wine as the drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: With a ram you are to supply four quarts of fine flour mixed with a quart and a half of oil as a grain offering,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will also present a quart of wine as the drink offering, a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are offering a young bull as a burnt offering or a sacrifice, which is to fulfill a vow or to be a fellowship offering to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: you are to present along with the young bull six quarts of fine flour mixed with two quarts of oil as a grain offering,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will present two quarts of wine as the drink offering, as a gift of food with a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is to be provided for each offering from the cattle, rams, lambs, or goats.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to supply these offerings for each sacrifice you prepare.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who is native-born is to do these things in this way when presenting a gift of food with a pleasing aroma to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For your generations to come, if an alien resides with you or someone else settles among you, and he wants to present a gift offered by fire, with a pleasing aroma to the Lord, he is to do just as you do.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the assembly there will be a single regulation for you and for the resident alien, a permanent regulation for your generations to come. You and the alien will be the same before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: There will be a single law and a single ordinance for you and the alien residing with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses
speaker: Narrator

text:
to speak to the Israelites and tell them this:
When you come to the land to which I am bringing you
speaker: Narrator

text: and when you eat from the food of the land, you are to present an elevated offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the first of your dough you are to present a round loaf as an elevated offering. You are to lift it up just like an elevated offering from the threshing floor.
speaker: Narrator

text: For your generations to come, you will give to the Lord an elevated offering from the first of your dough.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you err unintentionally and do not carry out all these commands, which the Lord has spoken to Moses—
speaker: Narrator

text: everything that the Lord has commanded you through Moses, from the day that the Lord first gave these commands and onward, for your generations to come—
speaker: Narrator

text: if it was done unintentionally, and the community was not aware of it, the entire community shall offer one young bull as a whole burnt offering, as a pleasing aroma to the Lord, with its grain offering and its drink offering, according to the ordinance, and one male goat as a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priest will make atonement for the entire Israelite community, and they will be forgiven, because it was an unintentional error. They are to bring their offering, a gift made by fire to the Lord, and their sin offering before the Lord for their unintentional error.
speaker: Narrator

text: The entire Israelite community and the aliens who reside among them will be forgiven, for all the people were involved in this error unintentionally.
speaker: Narrator

text: If one person errs unintentionally, he must present a year-old female goat for a sin offering.
speaker: Narrator
