text: Eleazar the priest said to the soldiers who had gone into battle, “These are the regulations which the Lord has commanded Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: The gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, and lead
speaker: Narrator

text: (everything that can withstand fire) you must be sure to pass through the fire, and it will be clean. It also is to be purified with the water for removing impurity. Everything that cannot withstand fire, you are to pass through the water.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and you will be clean. After that, you may come into the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “You, Eleazar the priest, and the leading fathers of the community are to count the spoils of war—the captives, both people and animals—
speaker: Narrator

text: and divide the spoils of war into two equal parts: one part for the troops who went out for combat and one for all the rest of the community.
speaker: Narrator

text: Raise a tribute to the Lord to be given by the fighting men who went out for battle. Take one out of every five hundred from the people, the cattle, the donkeys, and the flocks.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take it from the fighting men’s half, and give it to Eleazar the priest as an elevated offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also from the Israelites’ half, you will take one out of every fifty from the people, the cattle, the donkeys, the flocks, and all the animals, and give them to the Levites, who attend to the duties at the Lord’s Dwelling.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the spoils of war remaining from the plunder that the army took was 675,000 animals from the flocks,
speaker: Narrator

text: 72,000 cattle,
speaker: Narrator

text: 61,000 donkeys,
speaker: Narrator

text: and 32,000 people in all, that is, the women who had not had sexual relations with a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The half share for those who went out into combat numbered 337,500 animals from the flocks,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the tribute for the Lord from the flocks was 675.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cattle numbered 36,000; the tribute for the Lord was 72.
speaker: Narrator

text: The donkeys numbered 30,500; the tribute for the Lord was 61.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people numbered 16,000; the tribute for the Lord was 32 people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave the tribute, the elevated offering to the Lord, to Eleazar the priest as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Israelites’ half, which Moses set aside from the share of the men who fought,
speaker: Narrator

text: the community’s half share was 337,500 animals from the flocks,
speaker: Narrator

text: 36,000 cattle,
speaker: Narrator

text: 30,500 donkeys,
speaker: Narrator

text: and 16,000 people.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the Israelites’ half share Moses took one out of every fifty from the people and the animals and gave them to the Levites, who attended to the duties at the Lord’s Dwelling, as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The officers who were over the units of a thousand in the army—the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds—approached Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Moses, “Your servants have taken a head count of the fighting men who were under our command, and not one of them is missing.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we have brought as an offering to the Lord the gold items which every man acquired—armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces—to make atonement for ourselves before the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from them, all the crafted items.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the gold from the elevated offering that the commanders of thousands and the commanders of hundreds lifted up to the Lord amounted to 16,750 shekels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of the soldiers had taken plunder for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from the commanders of thousands and hundreds and brought it into the Tent of Meeting as a memorial for the Israelites before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Reuben and Gad had very large flocks and herds of livestock. They saw that the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead was ideal for livestock.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gad and Reuben came and spoke to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the tribal chiefs of the community. They said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon—
speaker: Narrator

text: the land which the Lord struck down before the community of Israel—is an ideal land for livestock. We, your servants, have livestock.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They continued, “If we have found favor in your eyes, let this land be given to your servants as a possession. Do not require us to cross the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the descendants of Gad and Reuben, “Do you expect your brothers to go into battle while you live here?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why are you disheartening the Israelites from crossing over into the land which the Lord has given to them?
speaker: Narrator

text: Your fathers did that same thing when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to see the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: They had gone up as far as the Valley of Eshcol and had seen the land. Then they disheartened the Israelites so that they would not go into the land which the Lord had given them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord’s anger burned on that day, and he swore an oath,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Surely none of the men twenty years old and up who came up from Egypt will see the land which I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, because they have not followed me completely,
speaker: Narrator

text: except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun, because they have followed the Lord completely.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord’s anger burned against Israel so he made them wander in the wilderness for forty years, until the entire generation that had done evil in the Lord’s sight was gone.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He continued, “See, here you are, a band of sinners standing in your fathers’ place, adding still more to the Lord’s fierce anger against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you turn away from following him, he will once again leave these people in the wilderness, and you will have destroyed all these people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They approached him and said, “We will build sheep pens here for our livestock and cities for our children,
speaker: Narrator

text: but we will be quick to arm ourselves to go ahead of the Israelites until we have brought them to their own places. Our children will live in our fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land,
speaker: Narrator

text: but we will not return to our houses until the Israelites have each taken possession of their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: We certainly will not have any claim to an inheritance with them on the other side of the Jordan, because our inheritance has come to us here on the east side of the Jordan, toward the sunrise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to them, “If you will do what you have said, if you will arm yourselves before the Lord for battle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and if every one of you who is armed will cross over the Jordan before the Lord until he has driven out his enemies before him,
speaker: Narrator

text: and until the land has been subdued before the Lord, then after that you may return home. You will be guiltless toward the Lord and Israel. This land will be a possession for you in the presence of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if you will not do this, look, you will have sinned against the Lord. Know that your sin will find you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Build cities for your children, and pens for your flocks, but keep the promises that have come out of your mouth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gad and Reuben spoke to Moses: “We, your servants, will do as my lord commands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our children, our wives, our livestock, and all our animals will stay here by the cities of Gilead,
speaker: Narrator

text: but your servants, every man who is armed for war, will cross over before the Lord for battle, as my lord says.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave a command concerning them to Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leading fathers of the Israelite tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to them, “If the descendants of Gad and Reuben, everyone who is armed for battle, will cross over the Jordan with you before the Lord, and the land is subdued before you, then you will give them the land of Gilead as a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if they are not willing to cross over with you armed, they will have an inheritance among you in the land of Canaan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gad and Reuben answered, “We will do what the Lord has said to us, your servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: We will cross over armed before the Lord into the land of Canaan, but the property that comes to us as our inheritance will be east of the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan to the descendants of Gad, to the descendants of Reuben, and to half of the tribe descended from Manasseh, the son of Joseph—the land including its cities with the territories surrounding them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gad rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
speaker: Narrator

text: Atroth Shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth Nimrah, and Beth Haran as fortified cities and built sheep pens there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Reuben built up Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nebo and Baal Meon (their names were changed), and Sibmah. They gave names to the cities they rebuilt.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Makir, the son of Manasseh, went to Gilead, captured it, and drove out the Amorites who were there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave Gilead to the clan of Makir, the descendants of Manasseh, and they lived there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, went and captured their villages and called them Havvoth Jair.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nobah went and captured Kenath and its settlements. He renamed it Nobah after himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the stages in the Israelites’ journey when they went out from the land of Egypt, lined up according to their military units, under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the command of the Lord, Moses recorded their departure locations according to the stages in their journey. These were the stages in their journey listed by their departure locations:
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month, the day after the Passover. The Israelites went out defiantly in the sight of all the Egyptians,
speaker: Narrator

text: while the Egyptians were burying all their firstborn, whom the Lord had struck down among them. The Lord also brought judgment on their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites set out from Rameses and camped at Sukkoth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Sukkoth and camped at Etham, which is on the edge of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Etham and turned back to Pi Hahiroth, which faces Baal Zephon. They camped in front of Migdol.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Pi Hahiroth and crossed through the middle of the sea into the wilderness. They traveled for three days in the Wilderness of Etham and camped at Marah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Marah and came to Elim. At Elim there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees. They camped there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Elim and camped by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the Red Sea and camped in the Wilderness of Sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the Wilderness of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Dophkah and camped at Alush.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rephidim and camped in the Wilderness of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the Wilderness of Sinai and camped at Kibroth Hatta’avah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Kibroth Hatta’avah and camped at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon Perez.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rimmon Perez and camped at Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Tahath and camped at Terah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Terah and camped at Mithkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Mithkah and camped at Hashmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Moseroth and camped at Bene Ja’akan.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Bene Ja’akan and camped at Hor Haggidgad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Hor Haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Abronah and camped at Ezion Geber.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Ezion Geber and camped in the Wilderness of Zin, that is, at Kadesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the edge of the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron the priest went up onto Mount Hor at the Lord’s command and died there in the fortieth year after the Israelites had come out of the land of Egypt, in the fifth month, on the first day of the month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron was one hundred twenty-three years old when he died at Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard that the Israelites were coming.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Punon and camped at Oboth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Oboth and camped at Iye Abarim, on the border of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Iyim and camped at Dibon Gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Dibon Gad and camped at Almon Diblathaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from Almon Diblathaim and camped by the mountains of the Abarim range, near Nebo.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set out from the mountains of Abarim and camped on the Plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: They camped by the Jordan, from Beth Jeshimoth to Abel Shittim, on the Plains of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the Plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, the Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them, ‘When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall drive out all the inhabitants of the land before you, destroy all their carved images and all their cast idols, and destroy all their high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take possession of the land and settle in it, because I have given the land to you to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall distribute the land as a possession by lot according to your clans. For a larger clan you shall increase its inheritance. For a smaller clan you shall decrease its inheritance. Wherever the lot falls for that clan, that will be its portion. You will distribute the land as a possession according to the tribes of your fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land before you, then those that you allow to remain will become barbs in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will cause trouble for you in the land where you will settle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will do to you what I planned to do to them.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses
speaker: Narrator

text:
to deliver these commands to the Israelites:
When you come into the land of Canaan (this is the land that will fall to you as an inheritance, the land of Canaan as defined by its boundaries),
speaker: Narrator

text: your southern border will extend from the Wilderness of Zin along the border of Edom. Your southern border on the east will start from the south end of the Dead Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your border will turn south of the Ascent of Akrabbim, pass through to Zin, and it will end south of Kadesh Barnea. Then it will go out to Hazar Adda and pass through to Azmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border will turn from Azmon to the Stream of Egypt, and it will end at the Mediterranean Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the western border, you will have the Mediterranean Sea as your border. This will be your western border.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will be your northern border: From the Mediterranean Sea you will draw a line for yourselves to Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Mount Hor you will draw a line to Lebo Hamath. The end of the border will be at Zedad.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the border will go to Ziphron, and it will end at Hazar Enan. This will be your northern border.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will draw a line to serve as your eastern border from Hazar Enan to Shepham.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border will go down from Shepham to Riblah, on the east side of Ain. The border will go down and meet the eastern slope of the Sea of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border will go down to the Jordan and end at the Dead Sea. This will be your land according to its boundaries on all sides.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded the Israelites, “This is the land which you will assign as a possession by lot, which the Lord has commanded you to give to the nine and a half tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tribe of Reuben’s descendants according to their fathers’ houses and the tribe of Gad’s descendants according to their fathers’ houses have already received their possession. Also half of the tribe of Manasseh has received its possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two and a half tribes have received their possession east of the Jordan across from Jericho, toward the sunrise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses:
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are the names of the men who will assign the land as a possession for you:
Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will take one tribal chief from every tribe to assign the land as a possession.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are the names of the men:
Caleb son of Jephunneh from the tribe of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Shemuel son of Ammihud from the tribe of Simeon’s descendants;
speaker: Narrator

text: Elidad son of Kislon from the tribe of Benjamin;
speaker: Narrator

text: Bukki son of Jogli, a tribal chief from the tribe of Dan’s descendants;
speaker: Narrator

text: from the sons of Joseph: Hanniel son of Ephod, a tribal chief from the tribe of Manasseh’s descendants;
speaker: Narrator

text: Kemuel son of Shiphtan, a tribal chief from the tribe of Ephraim’s descendants;
speaker: Narrator

text: Elizaphan son of Parnak, a tribal chief from the tribe of Zebulun’s descendants;
speaker: Narrator

text: Paltiel son of Azzan, a tribal chief from the tribe of Issachar’s descendants;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahihud son of Shelomi, a tribal chief from the tribe of Asher’s descendants;
speaker: Narrator

text: Pedahel son of Ammihud, a tribal chief from the tribe of Naphtali’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the men whom the Lord commanded to assign the areas of possession for the Israelites in the land of Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses on the Plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho:
speaker: Narrator

text: Command the people of Israel to give the Levites cities to live in from the territory assigned to them as their possession. They will also give the Levites the pasturelands around those cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites will then have cities to live in. Their pasturelands will be for their cattle, their flocks and herds, and all their other animals.
speaker: Narrator

text: The pasturelands of the cities, which you will give to the Levites, will extend out from the wall of the city 500 yards in all directions.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the eastern boundary you will measure 1000 yards in addition to the size of the city, 1000 yards as the southern boundary, 1000 yards as the western boundary, and 1000 yards as the northern boundary. The city is in the middle. This area will serve as the pasturelands of their cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities which you will give to the Levites will include six cities of refuge, which you will provide so that a person who has killed someone may flee there. In addition to these six cities, you will give them forty-two other cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the cities which you are to give to the Levites will total forty-eight cities along with their pasturelands.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cities which you will transfer to the Levites from the property of the Israelites, you will take more cities from a larger tribe and fewer from a smaller tribe. Every tribe will give some of its cities to the Levites in proportion to the amount of assigned territory it has received.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord told Moses
speaker: Narrator

text:
to speak to the Israelites and tell them this:
When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: you are to designate some cities to be cities of refuge for yourselves, so that a person who has killed someone by taking someone’s life unintentionally may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities will serve as a refuge for you from the avenger, so that a person who has killed someone will not die until he stands trial before the community.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities which you will set aside will serve as the six cities of refuge for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are to set aside three cities east of the Jordan and three cities in the land of Canaan. They will serve as cities of refuge.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six cities will serve as a refuge for Israelites, for resident aliens, and for temporary residents living among them so that everyone who has taken someone’s life unintentionally may flee there.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if a person strikes someone with an iron object so that he dies, that person is a murderer. The murderer must certainly be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a person strikes someone with a stone in his hand that could kill someone, and the victim dies, that person is a murderer. The murderer must certainly be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if a person strikes someone with a wooden object in his hand that could kill someone, and the victim dies, that person is a murderer. The murderer must certainly be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The avenger of blood himself will put the murderer to death. When he apprehends him, he is to put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a person pushes someone out of hatred or throws something at him with malicious intent so that he dies,
speaker: Narrator

text: or in hostility strikes him with his hand so that he dies, that person who struck him must certainly be put to death. He is a murderer. The avenger of blood is to put the murderer to death when he apprehends him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if a person pushes someone suddenly without hostility or throws any object at him without malicious intent,
speaker: Narrator

text: or if without looking he drops a stone on someone big enough to kill him and that person dies, since that person was not his enemy, and he did not seek to harm him,
speaker: Narrator

text: the community will judge between the killer and the avenger of blood according to these ordinances.
speaker: Narrator

text: The community will deliver the person who has killed someone from the hand of the avenger of blood. Then the community will take him back to his city of refuge, to which he had fled. He must live there until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if the person who has killed someone ever goes outside of the border of the city of refuge to which he has fled,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the avenger of blood finds him outside of the border of his city of refuge, and the avenger of blood kills the person who has killed someone, the avenger will not be guilty of bloodshed,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the person who has killed someone should have stayed in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest. But after the death of the high priest he may return to the land that is his possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things will be a legal statute for you throughout your generations wherever you live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who has taken someone’s life is to be put to death as a murderer on the testimony of witnesses, but no one is to die on the testimony of only one witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not to accept a ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of death, because he must certainly be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not to accept a ransom for the one who has fled to a city of refuge in order to allow him to return to live in his land before the death of the priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you are not to pollute the land where you are, because bloodshed pollutes the land. No atonement can be made for the land where blood has been shed except by the blood of the one who shed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are not to defile the land in which you are living, where I am dwelling in its midst, for I, the Lord, am dwelling in the midst of the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The leading fathers of the clan of the descendants of Gilead, the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, from the clans of the sons of Joseph, approached Moses and spoke to Moses and the tribal chiefs, the heads of the fathers’ houses of the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “The Lord commanded my lord to assign the land for the Israelites’ inheritance by lot. My lord was commanded by the Lord to give the inheritance of Zelophehad our brother to his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now, if they marry any of the men from the other Israelite tribes, then their inheritance would be taken away from our ancestral inheritance and would be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they married. So part of our allotted inheritance would be taken away.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Jubilee occurs for the Israelites, that inheritance would be added to the inheritance of the tribe into which they married. Therefore that inheritance will be taken away from the inheritance of our ancestral tribe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then at the Lord’s word, Moses commanded the Israelites, “What the tribe of Joseph’s descendants is saying is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the Lord commands for Zelophehad’s daughters: They may be married to whomever they wish, but they are to be married within the clan of their father’s tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that way no inheritance for the Israelites will transfer from tribe to tribe, for each of the Israelites is to keep the inheritance of his ancestral tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every daughter who possesses an inheritance in any of the Israelite tribes is to be married to someone from the clan of her father’s tribe, so that each of the Israelites will retain possession of the inheritance of his fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: So no inheritance will transfer from one tribe to another tribe, for each of the Israelite tribes will keep its own inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Zelophehad’s daughters did as the Lord commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelophehad’s daughters—Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah—were married to cousins on their father’s side.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were married to men from the clans of the descendants of Manasseh the son of Joseph. Their inheritance remained within the tribe of their father’s clan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the commands and the ordinances which the Lord commanded through Moses for the Israelites on the Plains of Moab near the Jordan across from Jericho.
speaker: Narrator
